title: Countdown

starterCode:

    # Print n, then countdown from n-1
    # When n <= 0, print "Blastoff!"
    pass

solution:
def countdown(n):
    if n <= 0:
        print("Blastoff!")
        return
    print(n)
    countdown(n - 1)

countdown(5)
hints: Base case: when n <= 0, print "Blastoff!" and return
Recursive case: print n, then call countdown(n - 1)
No return value needed - just print
Make sure to return after the base case!

title: Tower of Hanoi
description: Solve the Tower of Hanoi puzzle: move n disks from source peg to target peg using auxiliary peg. Print each move.
starterCode:
# Tower of Hanoi
def hanoi(n, source, target, auxiliary):
    # Base case: move single disk
    # Recursive case: move n-1 disks, then 1, then n-1
    pass

# Test your function
hanoi(3, "A", "C", "B")
solution:
def hanoi(n, source, target, auxiliary):
    if n == 1:
        print(f"Move disk 1 from {source} to {target}")
        return
    
    hanoi(n - 1, source, auxiliary, target)
    print(f"Move disk {n} from {source} to {target}")
    hanoi(n - 1, auxiliary, target, source)

hanoi(3, "A", "C", "B")
hints: Base case: n=1, just move the disk directly
To move n disks from A to C:
1. Move n-1 disks from A to B (using C)
2. Move disk n from A to C
3. Move n-1 disks from B to C (using A)
